alert.note: Alert for Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 8:17PM EDT until August 12 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central New York, including the following county, Dutchess. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 816 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen with additional heavy rain incoming. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area in under 2 hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beacon, Pawling, Wappingers Falls, Amenia, Fishkill, Millbrook, Millerton, Dover Plains, Wingdale, Hopewell Junction, Myers Corner, East Fishkill, Beekman, Bethel, Smithfield, Clove, North Clove, Hoxie Corner, Crouses Store and Camby. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report flooding to the National Weather Service by email at ALB.stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany.
